Dear Hagop,

 

Good afternoon!

 

With reference to the emails below in relation to the subject claim.

 

I tried to contact you at (04 804 5000) but unable to reach you. We need to understand the circumstances of the incident and take photographs of the affected incident premises.

 

Hence, could you please provide the contact detail of the effected shop in order to conduct our survey.

 

We look forward to hearing from you. 

 

In closing, we would ask you to note that our enquires require to be on a Without Prejudice Basis to the Issue of Policy Liability.

SR01, fire in the building's main electrical room has caused a power disruption on July 6, leading to an estimated closure period of up to 10 days.

 

According to Civil Defense officials, the fire was caused by a short circuit in the main power cable feeding the entire building. The shop remains non-operational with temporary closure signage displayed.

 

While there is no physical damage to the store, BI will likely trigger under the denial of access cover. I don't think a site inspection will be required at this stage given the lack of physical damage. However, we will need to model the expected loss of gross profit due to this disruption. I have already asked the team to provide the technical report from the contractor as well as photos of the electrical room damages and will forward it to you once i have it in hand.

 

Appreciate if you could open a claim file and advise the additional details you need in order to proceed with the claim.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 8045000

chunks.text:
With reference to property insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, please note an incident occurred at SHARJAH, King Faisal - The Deal- Mohd Ehsan Al Khaimeh Bldg. Unit no. SR01, fire in the building's main electrical room has caused a power disruption on July 6, leading to an estimated closure period of up to 10 days.

 

According to Civil Defense officials, the fire was caused by a short circuit in the main power cable feeding the entire building. The shop remains non-operational with temporary closure signage displayed.

 

While there is no physical damage to the store, BI will likely trigger under the denial of access cover. I don't think a site inspection will be required at this stage given the lack of physical damage. However, we will need to model the expected loss of gross profit due to this disruption. I have already asked the team to provide the technical report from the contractor as well as photos of the electrical room damages and will forward it to you once i have it in hand.

 

Appreciate if you could open a claim file and advise the additional details you need in order to proceed with the claim.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Hani,

 

Hope you are well!

 

With reference to property insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, please note an incident occurred at SHARJAH, King Faisal - The Deal- Mohd Ehsan Al Khaimeh Bldg. Unit no. SR01, fire in the building's main electrical room has caused a power disruption on July 6, leading to an estimated closure period of up to 10 days.

 

According to Civil Defense officials, the fire was caused by a short circuit in the main power cable feeding the entire building. The shop remains non-operational with temporary closure signage displayed.

 

While there is no physical damage to the store, BI will likely trigger under the denial of access cover. I don't think a site inspection will be required at this stage given the lack of physical damage. However, we will need to model the expected loss of gross profit due to this disruption. I have already asked the team to provide the technical report from the contractor as well as photos of the electrical room damages and will forward it to you once i have it in hand.

 

Appreciate if you could open a claim file and advise the additional details you need in order to proceed with the claim.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

SR01, fire in the building's main electrical room has caused a power disruption on July 6, leading to an estimated closure period of up to 10 days.

 

According to Civil Defense officials, the fire was caused by a short circuit in the main power cable feeding the entire building. The shop remains non-operational with temporary closure signage displayed.

 

While there is no physical damage to the store, BI will likely trigger under the denial of access cover. I don't think a site inspection will be required at this stage given the lack of physical damage. However, we will need to model the expected loss of gross profit due to this disruption. I have already asked the team to provide the technical report from the contractor as well as photos of the electrical room damages and will forward it to you once i have it in hand.

 

Appreciate if you could open a claim file and advise the additional details you need in order to proceed with the claim.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

ra@nascodubai.com <mailto:Hani.Gebara@nascodubai.com> >

Subject: Incident: Allied Enterprises LLC; Unit no. SR01, The Deal, King Faisal St., Sharjah

 

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Hani,

 

Hope you are well!

 

With reference to property insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, please note an incident occurred at SHARJAH, King Faisal - The Deal- Mohd Ehsan Al Khaimeh Bldg. Unit no. SR01, fire in the building's main electrical room has caused a power disruption on July 6, leading to an estimated closure period of up to 10 days.

 

According to Civil Defense officials, the fire was caused by a short circuit in the main power cable feeding the entire building. The shop remains non-operational with temporary closure signage displayed.

 

While there is no physical damage to the store, BI will likely trigger under the denial of access cover. I don't think a site inspection will be required at this stage given the lack of physical damage. However, we will need to model the expected loss of gross profit due to this disruption. I have already asked the team to provide the technical report from the contractor as well as photos of the electrical room damages and will forward it to you once i have it in hand.

 

Appreciate if you could open a claim file and advise the additional details you need in order to proceed with the claim.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن


Dear Hagop,

 

I hope you are doing well.

 

Further to my email below, please provide the following documents to support your claim. 

 

*	Police Report
*	Civil Defence report
*	Copy of the Firefighting maintenance contract for the current policy period 
*	Maintenance report from firefighting facilities for three months prior to the incident  
*	Copy of Civil Defence Certificate covering the current policy period 
*	Photos / Videos taken immediately after the loss
*	CCTV footage of the incident (if any)
*	Claim and supporting documents
*	Reservation of Rights: The incident report indicates that the root cause of the fire was due to inadequate maintenance of electrical assets owned by the building owner. This finding supports the initiation of a recovery claim against the building owner. Hence, please find attached a draft Reservation of Rights letter. Kindly issue this letter to the building owner, holding them responsible for the incident. Also, please provide us with a copy of the issued letter for the insurer's recovery process.

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Hani,

 

Hope you are well!

 

With reference to property insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, please note an incident occurred at SHARJAH, King Faisal - The Deal- Mohd Ehsan Al Khaimeh Bldg. Unit no. SR01, fire in the building's main electrical room has caused a power disruption on July 6, leading to an estimated closure period of up to 10 days.

 

According to Civil Defense officials, the fire was caused by a short circuit in the main power cable feeding the entire building. The shop remains non-operational with temporary closure signage displayed.

 

While there is no physical damage to the store, BI will likely trigger under the denial of access cover. I don't think a site inspection will be required at this stage given the lack of physical damage. However, we will need to model the expected loss of gross profit due to this disruption. I have already asked the team to provide the technical report from the contractor as well as photos of the electrical room damages and will forward it to you once i have it in hand.

 

Appreciate if you could open a claim file and advise the additional details you need in order to proceed with the claim.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

Appreciate your kind support.

chunks.text:
With reference to property insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, please note an incident occurred at SHARJAH, King Faisal - The Deal- Mohd Ehsan Al Khaimeh Bldg. Unit no. SR01, fire in the building's main electrical room has caused a power disruption on July 6, leading to an estimated closure period of up to 10 days.

 

According to Civil Defense officials, the fire was caused by a short circuit in the main power cable feeding the entire building. The shop remains non-operational with temporary closure signage displayed.

 

While there is no physical damage to the store, BI will likely trigger under the denial of access cover. I don't think a site inspection will be required at this stage given the lack of physical damage. However, we will need to model the expected loss of gross profit due to this disruption. I have already asked the team to provide the technical report from the contractor as well as photos of the electrical room damages and will forward it to you once i have it in hand.

 

Appreciate if you could open a claim file and advise the additional details you need in order to proceed with the claim.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

M.C.T. FZE

Dear Muhammed,

 

Hope you are well.

 

Can you please relay this to the store team to provide the below requested details?

 

*	Police Report
*	Civil Defence report
*	Copy of the Firefighting maintenance contract for the current policy period
*	Maintenance report from firefighting facilities for three months prior to the incident 
*	Copy of Civil Defence Certificate covering the current policy period
*	Photos / Videos taken immediately after the loss
*	CCTV footage of the incident (if any)
*	Claim and supporting documents
*	Reservation of Rights: The incident report indicates that the root cause of the fire was due to inadequate maintenance of electrical assets owned by the building owner. This finding supports the initiation of a recovery claim against the building owner. Hence, please find attached a draft Reservation of Rights letter. Kindly issue this letter to the building owner, holding them responsible for the incident. Also, please provide us with a copy of the issued letter for the insurer's recovery process.

 

Appreciate your kind support.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Kindly issue this letter to the building owner, holding them responsible for the incident. Also, please provide us with a copy of the issued letter for the insurer's recovery process.

 

In closing, we would ask you to note that our enquires require to be on a Without Prejudice Basis to the Issue of Policy Liability. ra@nascodubai.com <mailto:Hani.Gebara@nascodubai.com> >
Cc: Yogesh Naresh Patil <Yogesh.Patil@nascodubai.com <mailto:Yogesh.Patil@nascodubai.com> >
Subject: Incident: Allied Enterprises LLC; Unit no. SR01, The Deal, King Faisal St., Sharjah

 

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Hani,

 

Hope you are well!

 

With reference to property insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, please note an incident occurred at SHARJAH, King Faisal - The Deal- Mohd Ehsan Al Khaimeh Bldg. Unit no. SR01, fire in the building's main electrical room has caused a power disruption on July 6, leading to an estimated closure period of up to 10 days.

 

According to Civil Defense officials, the fire was caused by a short circuit in the main power cable feeding the entire building. The shop remains non-operational with temporary closure signage displayed.

 

While there is no physical damage to the store, BI will likely trigger under the denial of access cover. I don't think a site inspection will be required at this stage given the lack of physical damage. However, we will need to model the expected loss of gross profit due to this disruption. I have already asked the team to provide the technical report from the contractor as well as photos of the electrical room damages and will forward it to you once i have it in hand.

 

Appreciate if you could open a claim file and advise the additional details you need in order to proceed with the claim.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

Dear Muhammed,

 

Hope you are well.

 

Can you please relay this to the store team to provide the below requested details?

 

*	Police Report
*	Civil Defence report
*	Copy of the Firefighting maintenance contract for the current policy period
*	Maintenance report from firefighting facilities for three months prior to the incident 
*	Copy of Civil Defence Certificate covering the current policy period
*	Photos / Videos taken immediately after the loss
*	CCTV footage of the incident (if any)
*	Claim and supporting documents
*	Reservation of Rights: The incident report indicates that the root cause of the fire was due to inadequate maintenance of electrical assets owned by the building owner. This finding supports the initiation of a recovery claim against the building owner. Hence, please find attached a draft Reservation of Rights letter. Kindly issue this letter to the building owner, holding them responsible for the incident. Also, please provide us with a copy of the issued letter for the insurer's recovery process.

 

Appreciate your kind support.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

With reference to property insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, please note an incident occurred at SHARJAH, King Faisal - The Deal- Mohd Ehsan Al Khaimeh Bldg. Unit no. SR01, fire in the building's main electrical room has caused a power disruption on July 6, leading to an estimated closure period of up to 10 days.

 

According to Civil Defense officials, the fire was caused by a short circuit in the main power cable feeding the entire building. The shop remains non-operational with temporary closure signage displayed.

 

While there is no physical damage to the store, BI will likely trigger under the denial of access cover. I don't think a site inspection will be required at this stage given the lack of physical damage. However, we will need to model the expected loss of gross profit due to this disruption. I have already asked the team to provide the technical report from the contractor as well as photos of the electrical room damages and will forward it to you once i have it in hand.

 

Appreciate if you could open a claim file and advise the additional details you need in order to proceed with the claim.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

ra@nascodubai.com <mailto:Hani.Gebara@nascodubai.com> >
Cc: Yogesh Naresh Patil <Yogesh.Patil@nascodubai.com <mailto:Yogesh.Patil@nascodubai.com> >
Subject: Incident: Allied Enterprises LLC; Unit no. SR01, The Deal, King Faisal St., Sharjah

 

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Hani,

 

Hope you are well!

 

With reference to property insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, please note an incident occurred at SHARJAH, King Faisal - The Deal- Mohd Ehsan Al Khaimeh Bldg. Unit no. SR01, fire in the building's main electrical room has caused a power disruption on July 6, leading to an estimated closure period of up to 10 days.

 

According to Civil Defense officials, the fire was caused by a short circuit in the main power cable feeding the entire building. The shop remains non-operational with temporary closure signage displayed.

 

While there is no physical damage to the store, BI will likely trigger under the denial of access cover. I don't think a site inspection will be required at this stage given the lack of physical damage. However, we will need to model the expected loss of gross profit due to this disruption. I have already asked the team to provide the technical report from the contractor as well as photos of the electrical room damages and will forward it to you once i have it in hand.

 

Appreciate if you could open a claim file and advise the additional details you need in order to proceed with the claim.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION
